metadata.title: CVE-2022-23613 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
xrdp is an open source remote desktop protocol (RDP) server. In affectedversions an integer underflow leading to a heap overflow in the sesmanserver allows any unauthenticated attacker which is able to locally accessa sesman server to execute code as root. This vulnerability has beenpatched in version 0.9.18.1 and above. Users are advised to upgrade. Thereare no known workarounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23613` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xrdp - 0.9.12-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xrdp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.12-1ubuntu0.1+esm1').
